Entry.Title: US mail bombs: Person held after campaign against Trump critics
Entry.Description: The mail-bombing campaign in recent days has been aimed at critics of President Trump.

Entry.Title: Megan Lee: Pair guilty of girl's takeaway allergy death
Entry.Description: Allergy sufferer Megan Lee's father warned food shops not to "play Russian roulette with precious lives".

Entry.Title: Lord Hain branded 'arrogant' for naming Sir Philip Green
Entry.Description: Ex-Attorney General Dominic Grieve speaks out after Sir Philip Green is named over harassment claims.

Entry.Title: Ruth Davidson gives birth to baby boy
Entry.Description: The Scottish Conservative leader says she and partner Jen Wilson are "delighted" to welcome Finn to the world.

Entry.Title: Fracking in Lancashire suspended following earthquake
Entry.Description: Cuadrilla has halted drilling just 11 days after it won a court battle to allow work to start.

Entry.Title: Baby penguin with two 'gay' dads hatched in Sydney
Entry.Description: Same-sex penguin couple Sphen and Magic have hatched their first foster chick at Sea Life Sydney.

Entry.Title: Arrest over Salisbury Cathedral Magna Carta theft attempt
Entry.Description: A hammer-wielding man smashes holes into a glass box displaying a Magna Carta at Salisbury Cathedral.

Entry.Title: Cot designer jailed over baby's death
Entry.Description: Seven-month-old Oscar Abbey was found caught in the side of his cot bed at his home in York.

Entry.Title: Ryanair flight rant man says he is 'not a racist'
Entry.Description: David Mesher denies being a racist and said he had "a fit of temper" when he shouted at Delsie Gayle, 77.

Entry.Title: Crossrail delay: £350m loan for London route announced by government
Entry.Description: The £15bn route is Europe's biggest infrastructure project is expected to launch nine months late.

Entry.Title: HS2 construction: Moving the remains of 40,000 people
Entry.Description: Work begins to exhume thousands of skeletons to make way for HS2 construction.

Entry.Title: Road rage driver Darren Hefferman jailed for cyclist punch
Entry.Description: Darren Hefferman hit Gareth Marshall into oncoming traffic leaving the victim with multiple injuries.

Entry.Title: Brexit won't ruin Strictly Come Dancing - No 10
Entry.Description: It comes after Sir Vince Cable claimed dancers from EU countries might not be allowed in to the UK.

Entry.Title: Does Netflix's Sabrina the Teenage Witch reboot live up to the hype?
Entry.Description: How does the revamped teenage witch favourite fare with fans of the original, much-loved series?

Entry.Title: 'Justin Bieber's burrito' and other foods eaten 'wrong'
Entry.Description: A picture of someone who looks like Justin Bieber eating a burrito strangely, is weirding people out.

Entry.Title: Helping care leavers through performance art
Entry.Description: The government is introducing the Care Leaver Covenant which aims to provide work based opportunities to young people leaving the care system.

Entry.Title: Rihanna-inspired model Adetutu is challenging tribal marking stereotypes
Entry.Description: Nigerian model Adetutu is using social media to change the narrative of people with facial scarring.

Entry.Title: Roman Vishniac: Jewish photographer between World Wars
Entry.Description: An exhibition of Roman Vishniac, one of the most important documentary photographers of the 20th century.

Entry.Title: Homeless man turns Truro car park space into home
Entry.Description: Paul Lindsay-Jones says the corner of the multi-storey in Truro is his own "eight-storey hotel".

Entry.Title: Cannabidiol: 'It's just like having a shot of syrup'
Entry.Description: A coffee shop has opened in Swansea offering cannabidiol, a non-psychoactive cannabis plant extract.

Entry.Title: Quiz of the Week: Which reality TV show was tried in job centres?
Entry.Description: It's the weekly news quiz - have you been paying attention to what's been going on in the world during the past seven days?

Entry.Title: Simon Jack and DJ Sideman: How not to spend your money
Entry.Description: BBC Business Editor Simon Jack talks to Radio 1 Xtra DJ Sideman about all things money.

Entry.Title: On America's trail of destruction
Entry.Description: Authorities have seized enough fentanyl to kill every American. It's a crisis that lines one major highway.

Entry.Title: BBC News Channel
Entry.Description: BBC coverage of latest developments

Entry.Title: Megyn Kelly: Could 'blackface' row end TV anchor's career?
Entry.Description: The future of Megyn Kelly, one of America's highest paid and best-known news anchors, is in doubt.

Entry.Title: Driverless cars: Who should die in a crash?
Entry.Description: A global study suggests people prefer to save young over elderly people.

Entry.Title: My intersex life: Now I have a new penis, I hope I will find love
Entry.Description: Anick - who was born intersex - had a series of operations to give him a fully-functioning penis. The BBC followed his progress.

Entry.Title: Leaving care: 'A spare room changed my life'
Entry.Description: "When I tell people about my previous life you can see their jaws drop," says 18-year-old Chloe.

Entry.Title: Universal Credit: Will benefit changes affect you?
Entry.Description: The benefit system is causing "unacceptable hardship" but officials refuse to listen, say MPs.

Entry.Title: Brexit and the booming British strawberry
Entry.Description: British berry growers have expanded rapidly on the back of cheap EU labour but the good times could soon be over.

Entry.Title: INF treaty: Putin shrugs off Trump’s nuclear arms move
Entry.Description: Russia's president appears to relish mirroring President Trump's decision to scrap the INF treaty.

Entry.Title: Budget 2018: What we know already
Entry.Description: Some of the ways in which your finances will be affected are already clear - even before Monday's Budget.

Entry.Title: Murder memorials: A grisly history written in stone
Entry.Description: The grisly history behind murder stones - monuments to victims of crimes that outraged local communities.

Entry.Title: Helping kids cope with the fear of medical treatment
Entry.Description: Hi-tech gadgets are helping sick children express their feelings and soothe their fears.

Entry.Title: Wildlife trade: Why lion cubs are turning up across Europe
Entry.Description: Cubs have been found in Paris and the Netherlands. Where do they come from? And who is buying them?

Entry.Title: Sexually transmitted infections: What to do if you get one
Entry.Description: Don't panic - these are the steps you need to take if you have an STI.

Entry.Title: David de Gea: Man Utd manager Jose Mourinho 'not confident' over new deal for keeper
Entry.Description: Manchester United boss Jose Mourinho is "not confident" keeper David de Gea will sign a new contract - but says he is "not worried".

Entry.Title: Pep Guardiola: Man City, Liverpool, Chelsea, Arsenal and Tottenham all in race
Entry.Description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola "has no doubt" there is a five-horse race for the Premier League title after nine games.

Entry.Title: Central contracts wrong for England, says clubs' boss Mark McCafferty
Entry.Description: Central contracts for top England players are "definitely not right" for the English system, says clubs' boss Mark McCafferty.

Entry.Title: Premier League predictions: Lawro v Richard Ashcroft
Entry.Description: BBC Sport football pundit Mark Lawrenson takes on singer Richard Ashcroft to predict this weekend's Premier League results.

Entry.Title: Caroline Wozniacki: World number three opens up about arthritis diagnosis
Entry.Description: World number three Caroline Wozniacki speaks out about being diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, but says she does not want it to "hinder" her.

Entry.Title: Scott Westgarth: 'There could have been resentment' - Dec Spelman on opponent's death
Entry.Description: Dec Spelman reveals how he has reconciled with the family of Scott Westgarth, who died after the pair's fight in February.

Entry.Title: 'The food supplement that ruined my liver'
Entry.Description: Jim McCants took a food supplement to help him get healthy in middle age, but it left him in need of an urgent liver transplant.

Entry.Title: Saudi Arabia's missing princes
Entry.Description: In the last two years, three Saudi princes living in Europe have disappeared. All were critical of the Saudi government.

Entry.Title: US mail bombs: Man held after campaign against Trump critics
Entry.Description: The 56-year-old is detained after a mail-bombing campaign aimed at critics of President Trump.
